intro: Ctenitis waiwaiensis, commonly known as the Waiwai fern, is a species of tree fern native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnately divided fronds. The plant has a slow growth rate and can reach heights of up to 10 meters in optimal conditions. Its fronds are typically dark green and have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental value. Ctenitis waiwaiensis plays a role in providing habitat for various tropical organisms and is often found in shaded, moist environments.
